data.title: The 55+ Best NBA Indiana Pacers Power Forwards
data.meta_description: Over 100 sports fans have voted on the 55+ Best NBA Indiana Pacers Power Forwards. Current Top 3: Jermaine O'Neal, Domantas Sabonis, George McGinnis
data.text:
Ranked By

1.0K votes

166 voters

1 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Indiana Pacers

Latest additions: Pascal Siakam

Most divisive: Tyler Hansbrough

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 55+ Best NBA Indiana Pacers Power Forwards

Big fan of Indiana basketball? Then check out this list of Indiana Pacers power forwards. It includes almost every power forward from throughout Indiana Pacers history, including current power forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA power forwards of all time, the best Pacers PFs include Antonio Davis, David West, Domantas Sabonis, Jermaine O'Neal, and Dale Davis.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Indiana Pacers starting PFs and backup PFs are Domantas Sabonis, Torrey Craig, and Oshae Brissett.

Who are the best power forwards in Indiana Pacers history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Indiana Pacers power forward of all time!

Birthplace : Columbia, South Carolina, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Boston Celtics

Position : Power forward, Center

Indiana Pacers: 2000–2008

A force to be reckoned with, Jermaine O'Neal joined the Indiana Pacers in 2000 as a result of a trade with the Portland Trail Blazers. Known for his exceptional shot-blocking and mid-range shooting abilities, O'Neal quickly became a key player, earning six consecutive NBA All-Star selections from 2002-2007. Throughout his tenure with the Pacers, he racked up numerous personal accolades, including the NBA's Most Improved Player Award in 2002 and was instrumental in propelling the team to the playoffs multiple times.

Birthplace : Kaunas, Lithuania

Nationality : Lithuania

Team : Sacramento Kings

Position : Power forward

Indiana Pacers: 2017-2022

Son of legendary Arvydas Sabonis, Domantas Sabonis joined the Pacers in 2017 as part of a trade with the Oklahoma City Thunder. Known for his blue-collar work ethic and relentless pursuit on the glass, Sabonis has become a fan-favorite in Indiana. As a two-time NBA All-Star (2020, 2021), he has arguably become one of the best passing big men in the league, elevating the play of those around him and making the Pacers a formidable opponent.

Birthplace : Indianapolis, Indiana

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Philadelphia 76ers

Position : Power forward

Indiana Pacers: 1971–1975, 1979–1982

One of the most storied players in Pacers history, George McGinnis began his professional career in the ABA, where he won two championships with Indiana before making the jump to the NBA in 1975. A versatile and explosive scorer, McGinnis dazzled fans with his ability to dominate both inside the paint and from the perimeter. As a six-time NBA/ABA All-Star and the 1975 ABA MVP, McGinnis left an indelible mark on the Pacers organization and the basketball world at large.

Birthplace : Toccoa, Georgia

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Power forward, Center

Indiana Pacers: 1991–2000, 2004–2005

Drafted by the Pacers in 1991, Dale Davis spent nearly a decade in Indiana, where he became synonymous with bruising rebounding and fearsome interior defense. A one-time NBA All-Star (2000), Davis was known for his ability to outmuscle opponents on the glass and finish with authority around the rim. His contributions to the team's success helped propel the Pacers to five Eastern Conference Finals appearances and their first-ever NBA Finals in 2000.

Birthplace : Leverkusen, Germany

Nationality : German

Team : Portland Trail Blazers, Dallas Mavericks, Indiana Pacers, Seattle Supersonics

Position : Small forward

Indiana Pacers: 1988–1993

The German-born sharpshooter, Detlef Schrempf, was acquired by the Pacers in a trade with the Dallas Mavericks in 1989. With the ability to stretch the floor and knock down jumpers from beyond the arc, Schrempf became a valuable offensive weapon for Indiana. Earning the NBA's Sixth Man of the Year award in both 1991 and 1992, he played an instrumental role in the Pacers' rise to prominence in the early 1990s.

Birthplace : Teaneck, New Jersey

Nationality : American

Team : New Orleans Pelicans, Indiana Pacers, Golden State Warriors

Position : Power forward

Indiana Pacers: 2011–2015

Signing with Indiana in 2011, David West provided the Pacers with much-needed scoring and an unwavering veteran presence. Known for his mid-range shooting ability and fundamentally sound post moves, West helped guide the team to back-to-back Eastern Conference Finals appearances in 2013 and 2014. His leadership on and off the court played a crucial role in the development of the young core that would shape the Pacers' future.
